snippet: The violence recalls a tortured past and, perhaps, hints at future tensions as Turkey prepares to face the 100th anniversary of the Armenian genocide.
abstract: String of attacks on elderly Armenian women in Istanbul have reawakened fears of return to times when minorities in Turkey were widely discriminated against; violence recalls tortured past, but also might hint at future tensions as Turkey prepares to face 100th anniversary of genocide of its Armenian population in last years of Ottoman Empire.
lead_paragraph: The violence recalls a tortured past and, perhaps, hints at future tensions as Turkey prepares to face the 100th anniversary of the Armenian genocide.

headline.seo: Attacks on Elderly Armenian Turks Awaken Fears
headline.main: Attacks on Elderly Armenian Women in Turkey Awaken Fears
headline.print_headline: Attacks on Elderly Armenian Women in Turkey Awaken Fears

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
